page.title: 04COOPERS' COBORN SCHOOL
page.content: This account was written by{Avjinder {Singh}to mark{450 years}since the foundation of{Coopers' Company's {school}in 1536. There were originally two separate schools:the Coborn school for girls and the Coopers' Company's school for boys.The former was founded by Prisca Coborn and the latter by Nicholas Gibson. The two schools amalgamated in 1974 when they moved from Bow to its present surroundings in Upminster.The new school enjoys quiet surroundings on the edge of London's Green Belt.The school has a 20 acre sports field with excellent facilities for sport which include a swimming pool,tennis courts, a gymn and a large and well appointed Sports Hall.
